column1: Hey Aryan! Time to test what you've learned!
Don't worry - you've got this! Take your time and have fun!
- Multiple choice: Write the letter (A, B, C, or D)
- Fill-in-blank: Write the formula or answer
- Check your answers at the bottom (no peeking!)
- Each question is worth points as shown

column2: What formula adds up all values in cells A1 through A10? (Hint: It's not =A1+A2+A3... because ain't nobody got time for that!)
Which of these is the CORRECT way to write a formula in Excel?
If A1=10, A2=20, A3=30, what does =AVERAGE(A1:A3) return?
(Math time! You can do it, Aryan!)
You have sales data in B2:B100. Which formula counts how many cells have numbers?
(Hint: It's not =COUNT-SHEEP though that would be more relaxing)
Complete this IF formula: =IF(A1>100, ___, ___) to show 'Big' if true, 'Small' if false
What does this formula return if B1=75? =IF(B1>=60, 'Pass', 'Fail')
Which operator means 'not equal to' in Excel?
Write a nested IF: If score>=90 show 'A', if score>=80 show 'B', else show 'C'. Score is in cell D1.
(This is a tough one! Take your time, superstar!)
D) Should use IF() not IF
In =VLOOKUP(lookup_value, table_array, col_index_num, [range_lookup]), what does col_index_num mean?
A) The row number to look in
B) Which column to return the value from
C) How many columns in the table
D) The column where lookup_value is
You're looking up employee ID 'E001' in table A1:D100. You want their salary from column 4. Write the VLOOKUP.
(Remember: VLOOKUP is like asking Excel to be your personal assistant!)
What does FALSE (or 0) mean in the last argument of VLOOKUP?
A) The lookup value doesn't exist in the table
C) Excel doesn't like you today
D) The formula is too long
If your lookup column is NOT the first column of your data, what function might work better than VLOOKUP?
(Hint: It's a combo move! Two functions working together!)

column1: Great job completing the quiz, Aryan!
Now scroll down for answers... but only after you've tried everything!
===== ANSWER KEY (No peeking until you're done!) =====

column3: The SUM function adds up a range of cells
Text values go in quotes, separated by commas
Nested IFs check conditions in order
Arguments must be separated by commas
col_index_num tells VLOOKUP which column to return
Look up E001, return column 4, exact match
These can look up from any column!
AMAZING! You're an Excel superstar, Aryan!
Excellent work! You really know your stuff!
Great job! Just a bit more practice and you'll be perfect!
Good effort! Review the tricky parts and try again!
Keep going! Rome wasn't built in a day and neither are Excel skills!
No worries! Go back through the lessons and give it another shot. You've got this!

column1: Remember Aryan: Every Excel expert was once a beginner!
Keep practicing and you'll be amazing!
